page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: {TOPOGRAPHY}Southminster lies astride the gravel ridge which runs North South across the Dengie peninsula and a central East-West ridge.From an average height in the village of 20 metres the landrises to 45 metres in the West (Mayland Mill).The central ridge is undulating and given over mainly to arable and fruit farming.In the extreme N.W. the land falls steeply to the Blackwater. {SOILS.}Southminster and immediate environs, terrace sands and glacial gravels.To the West,most soils are London clay, except extreme S.W.which is pebbly clay drift over Bagshot sands. {CLIMATE}North-easterly winds in Winter often bring low temperatures and occasional snow and sleet showers. Summer temperatures average 70F. Average annual rainfal 19in.
